medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Ms. V started smoking at age 9 and developed a consistent habit of 1 pack per day by age 12. Currently, she smokes 1 to 2 packs per day, with increased consumption during stressful times. She has attempted to quit multiple times but has not been successful.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Type 1 diabetes mellitus diagnosed in 1990, complicated by peripheral neuropathy; migraine headaches; carpal tunnel syndrome; hyperlipidemia; herniated lumbar disks; recurrent bronchitis and sinusitis; chronic pelvic pain; multiple laparoscopies and a sacral sympathectomy; appendectomy; left knee arthroscopy; tubal ligation.
medical_history.family_history: Several family members on her mother's side have hypertension, diabetes, and hyperlipidemia. Two of her children have asthma. Her father's history is unknown.
medical_history.social_history: Ms. V is a smoker, drinks alcohol rarely, and works at the public counter of a federal agency. She has three children and lives near Boston.
